captions.text: Team Cat Mojo-- it's in the air.
Love is in the air.
It's Valentine's Day.
That's right.

It is a perfect time to learn
about the cat I love you.

Are you guys ready
to get catified?
Oh yeah.
Let's go.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
All right, y'all.

It is time to learn
about the cat I love you.

What is the cat I love you, you
ask yourself, or you ask me.

If you've watched "My Cat
from Hell," even that all,

you've probably seen me
walking around talking

to cats by blinking at
them, the slow blink, right.

Believe me, I know a
whole lot of people

know about this now because
you walk up to me in the street
and you blink at me.

Which is weird,
but totally cool.

Because the concept
is everyone's

getting to know the
language of cats.

Way back in the
'90s, early '90s,

I was learning how
to be a cat boy.

I was working at
an animal shelter.

And I learned that
cats liked me.

I was so obsessed
with these guys

and obsessed with learning
about their world.
So I started reading.

And one of the books that jumped
out at me in the beginning,

made me feel like, hey, there
might be a community of people

who think like me,
or who are obsessed

the way I am, and this woman
right here led the way.
Her name is Anitra Frazier.

This is actually
my copy of the book
that I got back the early '90s.
Go figure.

In this book I was reading
about the cat I love you.

And basically she was talking
about how she learned this

by walking down the streets in
the Upper West Side of New York

and just looking in the
windows of the brownstones

and seeing cats in
there and noticing
that they were blinking.
What is that, she wondered.
So she would blink back at them.

And suddenly there
was a language
between Anitra and these cats.

And that became
the cat I love you.

They're letting you know that
they are vulnerable to you.

These are prey
animals, animals that

sleep with one eye open,
almost literally, cat napping.

Because they don't want to
be preyed upon in the wild.

So the concept of closing their
eyes to you in a slow way--

not something that they would
do very willingly unless they're
trying to tell you something.

In the spirit of
Valentine's Day now

I'm going to teach you how
to do the cat I love you.

If you stare at people they
tend not to trust you very much,
you know?

So if you're doing-- we're
going to lose our glasses now.
When you do this, stare.

Now I'm even-- let's remove
my facial expressions.
Not very inviting.

So the secret is to
relax, relax your face.

So do this with me--
a little scrunch up,
a little Gilbert Gottfried here.
And then release it.
Now you got it.
Now we're softening our eyes.

This is the way that we want to
approach a cat, with soft eyes.
We're not staring at them.

So let's take it
to the next step.

When you look you soften, and
then behind your vocal box--

don't use your words,
just think them.
I'm not speaking right now.
I'm thinking.

You're hearing my
inside voice right now.
I love you.
One more time.
Take your time with that.
That's kind of key.

When your cat does
that to you, remember--

they are showing
vulnerability, in which case

we're not just going
I love you-- oh, what?

I love you-- oh,
are you still there?
You know what I'm saying?
That shows lack of trust.

Trust is really closing
your eyes to the world.
Practice that with your cat.

What about the cat I
love you how ya doin'?

When you walk into a room
and your cat sees you,

tell me your cat doesn't do
yeah, yeah, how ya doin'?
I just did it.

So let's incorporate the cat
I love you with the how ya

doin', which is the cat I love
you how ya doin', originally
enough.
So you go--
Try it!

I'm telling you, you
feel stupid doing it.
But try it, all right?
Now let's try the bow.

And the bow is you're literally
just bowing to your cat.

But you don't necessarily
have to go all the way down.

And in the same way, you don't
have to do the all the way
blink.
The I love you bow is like this.

It's almost as if in the back of
your head you're saying, yeah,
I love you.
Yeah.

Let me teach you about
the 3-step handshake.

The 3-step handshake
is using the cat

I love you in succession
with some other things.

People are always wondering
why they can't pet a cat.

Because you didn't
ask permission.
That's why.

This is how you ask permission,
the three-step handshake.

First we're going
to try the blink.

Yeah, throw in a how ya
doin', throw in the bow, OK.

Next thing you do is you present
something with your scent on it
for them to explore.
Often I will use these bad boys.

Step three finally
of the handshake,

the real how ya doin', is
offering your hand to your cat.

Now the thing that
I will always do

is extend my hand in
a very relaxed way.

I'll treat this
finger like a nose,

because cats often
will nose to nose.
There's my nose.
I'll present to them.

And often what they
will do once they

trust you is allow
them to pet you.

They will then push their
nose up, towards the third eye
here, and down.

These are universal
signs that your cat
has fed you over and over again.

And if you just use them up a
little bit, don't feel silly.

I mean literally, we're behind
closed doors here, just you
and me in the cat cave.
Try it.
And try it with your cat.
Of course that's homework.

Go and try the cat I
love you with your cat.

A true expression of your
love for a cat is saying,

I will communicate
on your terms.

The cat I love you,
the 3-step handshake,

the how ya doin', the
bow, the finger nose--

all those things are going
to their side of the fence.
And let me know about it.

Write some comments
right down here.

Subscribe to this
channel, by the way.

Write to me on Facebook
and Twitter and Instagram.
Show me some videos, man.

Show me some videos,
and pictures,

of you doing the cat I love
you, or your cat doing it back

to you, or doing the how ya
doin' or the finger nose.

I would love to see
all those things.

I mean, honestly, if you want
to do a great Valentine's Day

thing for the Cat
Daddy, show me some

of that stuff with
you and your cats.
Videos man, I love that stuff.

Some pictures on Instagram--
I love that stuff.
Please bring it on.

I want to tell you
one more thing.

I want you to look
at this right here.
Cats are cool.
People we all knew that, right?

Go to catsrcool.org
and you can find out

some more about this
very interesting program.

Speaking of Cats R
Cool, Cats R Cool

sponsors me and my tour,
the Cats Uncaged tour.

And it's coming to
some places near you,
not so far off in the future.

If you want to find out more
about it, go to my website.
Sign up for the newsletter.

Check it out right here
on the Animalist Network,
and on YouTube.

And you will find
out when I will

be traveling with Cats
Uncaged at a shelter near you,

in a town near you, under
the Cats R Cool banner.

So folks, happy
Valentine's Day to you.
Go and spread that love.
Go blink a little bit.
Go do the how ya doin'.

Let me see it from
you and your cat.

In the meantime, I have
no way of expressing

how big my heart is
for team Cat Mojo.

You people have been
coming out in force,

letting me know how you
feel about Cat Mojo.
And I'm pretty psyched about it.

Until next time, all
light, all love, all mojo.
[KISSES]
Love you.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

title: 4 Ways to Tell Your Cat "I Love You!"

comments.text:
I did the wink I love you to my cat three times and immediately after he 
snuggled next to me! My heart melted.﻿
comments.author: Juan Lara-Ruiz

comments.text:
I looked at my cat and when I slow blinked he did it back ^_^ It was so 
cute.﻿
comments.author: Psychotic Kitten

comments.text:
Me and my cat, Babygirl, Yes that is her name. We share a pretty strong 
bond. She always wants to be with me. No matter where she is I just whisper 
her name and she comes barreling down the house to see me. she always purrs 
when I pet her, She allows me to clean her eyes of sleepies. she will 
nuzzle and lick my hand like a thank you.  Whenever I am reading or 
relaxing? She will always jumps on my lap and or somewhere near me and fall 
asleep. My cat is a lovable angel. Hell, she is more like a dog then a cat 
cause she is so damn docile and cuddly. She may of bitten me once or twice 
as a kitten but that is about it. She will even allow me to pet her when 
she is eating, which is kind of funny cause here she is chomping on cat 
food and trying to purr at the same time, but I don't do it that often 
cause I don't want her to end up choking on food.﻿
comments.author: Skarlett Roo

comments.text:
Okay.. I really need to know how to tell my cat to STOP being all over me 
all the time. 
He wakes me up in the middle of the night because I cant breathe (his butt 
is on my face), then I sit up and he wraps himself around my neck like a 
scarf. I can even walk around for hours doing other stuff, and he is still 
there! When I finally convince him to stay on the floor (or furniture) he 
STALKS me. Everywhere I go, he is there. Im almost stepping on him like 100 
times a day, and he WONT shut up. EVER! He is talking to me ALL the time. 
Anyone knows how to fix this without having to kill him or saw off his legs 
or something?
I cant even take a shower by myself. If I shut the door, he is almost 
breaking it.﻿
comments.author: Karen Madsen

comments.text:
I did not think of this as a cat I love you, but I used this to build a 
trust bond with cats, like I close my eyes and trust you not to harm me. My 
friend has this realy shy tomcat and I managed to get his trust realy fast. 
I am so happy now, he is a darling. Many people approach cats all the wrong 
way. Very often even like dogs, wich is wrong in my eyes.﻿

cheek.Complete trust.﻿

comments.text:
I do all these with my paw paw 's formal feral cat that we now own. and now 
shes so happily obsessed with pushing my entire HAND up onto her head to 
pet and love her. I also do the chest pat thump like a heartbeat like large 
cats would do. Or even domestics. She goes so happy / balistic with purrs 
chirps and snuffle chuffs. So, I return them﻿
comments.author: Moonstone Wind

comments.text: My cat does the finger-nose thing, but he does it with my actual nose -_-﻿
comments.author: Charity Diary

comments.text:
I sware thus works my cat literally jumped on me and did nose to nose and 
rubbed her head on mine!! Great﻿
comments.author: Kate Smith

comments.text:
We have two adopted cats, one is a shorthair black 10 year old obese cat 
with a deformed front leg we adoped in January, he's sweetheart that shows 
everyone in the house love and goes NUTS with me when I give him any form 
of a cat "I love you" and goes into a petting frenzy and snuggles with me. 
Then there's The Psycho. She's a 5 year old long haired tuxedo the size of 
a 6 month old cat rescued as a kitten from a truck trying to run over her 
and that had squished her litter-mates. She not violent, she just lets her 
body language to let me know I'm not appreciated by staring and running 
away if I get near and by looking me in the eyes and doing things I just 
told her not to do slowly and deliberately and then running away real fast, 
and wants nothing to do with me except to alert me when she's hungry or to 
wake me up or lead me to bed by loudly meowing - but not going near me - 
when she thinks I'm not sticking to The Schedule. She doesn't like all 
women in general, or strangers, and LOVES my husband and kinda likes my son 
- only when my husband is gone, though. Nobody is as important than my 
husband to her.﻿
comments.author: Candi Walkowski

comments.text:
So I was play fighting with our cat, and we told him "we love you", and he 
was very lovey and adorable. Thanks Jackson!﻿
comments.author: Edgar Torres-Fuentes

comments.text:
I'm getting my first kitty tomorrow and I'm definitely going to try this! 
Your videos are so great thank you! lol﻿
comments.author: ecbubbly

comments.text:
My cat was snuggling with me last night (which is rare since he prefers my 
husband), and he was purring and just being generally cuddly. I would close 
my eyes slowly and then look at him again and he would keep his eyes wide 
open but look down or away to not look at me directly. What's that mean?﻿

comments.text: it worked that was so cool﻿

comments.text:
I do the same things to My cats but I never actually knew that was a thing, 
I just did it cuz they do that to me and when I pet them I look at them and 
put my hand to the nose even though I never knew that I actually have to do 
that 😂 but I never cave them anything of my scent but I'll keep that in 
mind Thx and no wonder why she is right next to me purring while I'm 
petting her! ﻿
comments.author: Kittykat Lover

comments.text:
I raised both of my kitties from the bottle, let them sleep with me, and I 
am able to wash in the tub, clip their nails, and do pretty much anything I 
need to without them throwing a fit.

The only time they don't want to be petted by me is when they want to play; 
however, they act like ordinary cats around other humans. They're not 
unfriendly, but they seem to just tolerate other people.﻿

comments.text:
I guess my cat really really loves me because when my cat was pregnant ( my 
cat was born feral and this is important for what I'm about to tell you) 
she HATED everyone except me, people would walk up to her she would be like 
5 feet away and she would jolt away I mean like sprinting away! ANYWAY my 
cat had 5 kittens and she was very protective she would bite anyone but me 
:-) and she would actually let me hold her kittens! She would sit on my lap 
and hold her kittens and actually let me pet them! They all would do the 
"slow blink" and just purr,it is AMAZING﻿

comments.author: Ebony Spicer

comments.text:
Thank you so much Jackson. My cat walks up to ME now and jumps up onto my 
lap. I don't have to go looking for him when I enter a room and wear tennis

comments.text:
My Kitty cries for Me when I leave the room its So adorable she's like my

comments.author: Elsy Hernandez

comments.text: I will surely try this!!﻿
comments.author: Doris Jamoner

comments.text:
I think this is a mostly a case of humans copying a common cat mannerism, 
foolishly believing we can communicate with them as if it means something. 
It's just a mannerism built into Cat physiology. There is no way of 
understanding without any doubt what it actually means to a Cat.

My cat never does this back to me. He just stares at me even if I slow 
blink him. It's like admitting your love to someone and them calling you 
'sucka' or making you feel stupid for it.

I feed him twice a day, let him out to play and spend my personal time 
playing with him using toys like strings and ropes for him and give him a 
home and I get nothing back. Cat's are ungrateful and selfish. Owning a cat 
is a thankless task. They are stupid animals that operate on instincts to 
be fed and to survive instead of having any intelligence. They will happily 
bite and claw the hand that feeds them without giving a fuck. How 
intelligent can you be to do something as stupid as that?

At least a dog is capable of showing emotion and intelligence and 
understands the consequences of misbehaving and is capable of learning from 
it's mistakes.﻿
comments.author: Harry “HAZZSTA” R

comments.text:
My cat doesn't notice crap when I do that slow blink but she sleeps with 
me, follows me everywhere even when i'm pooping in the bathroom and comes 
to me when I call her. So your cat doesn't always have to behave like that 
i realize. This is a very cool information though.﻿

comments.text:
I do the how you doing thing to my cat all the time cause she does it to me 
I just thought it was funny I didn't know I was building a good 
relationship with her XD ﻿
comments.author: Analeigh Rose

comments.text: My cat loves me too much.﻿
comments.author: Jeremiah Metzger

comments.text:
My cat lets me pet her almost anywhere! Rub\scratch her chin? Yea. Scratch 
out and inside her ear? Pffff like everyday! Rub her belly? Almost 24/7!! 
Lightly stroke her paws and legs? Yea its common. And a few other places. 
She must really love me!!﻿
comments.author: Alyssa Bullock

comments.text: My cat won't let me pick her up or stroke her tummy :(
comments.author: EnderSource

comments.text: I have a friend Karolina and she LOVES cats!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!:o﻿
comments.author: Artyom Bubulchuk

comments.text:
I did the slow blink with my cat Toto (named after the band) a couple of 
times now and 95% of the time he would return it to me.    He has gotten 
used to me rubbing his belly for a short time, but he is the first cat I 
owned and I grew up with dogs.    From now on I will see if he prefers me 
rubbing his chin rather than his belly.    I am also looking forward to 
trying the "how're you doing) nod.﻿
comments.author: Carin Coetzee

comments.text:
Me and my sister have grown up around cats and are starting to read books 
about cat body language! Today I found out on my own when I was petting my 
cat, you can get them to clean themselves or bacillus say "go take a bath" 
by picking prices of long of dirt out of there fur! Did you know that? Ok 
this comments really long so bye! ﻿

comments.text:
I actually greet people with the 'how ya doin' thing and the blink, but 
never my cat. People are cool with me, but some cats are skittish. I think 
I should break down my separation between the two more.﻿

comments.text:
Yep, we are 'those' kind of cat people! We love, pet and play with our fur 
children like other cats do. Roll around on the floor and head boop with 
em! But seriously dude, WHY does my cat 'bathe' me with his sandpaper 
tongue!?! Freaky, but sweet lol :) Rock on JG!﻿

comments.text:
my cat, tenzo, responds more to me saying "i love you" versus the cat i 
love you. every time i tried doing the cat i love you, he wouldn't respond, 
but when i say it, he'll make a little noise. kind of in between a meow and 
a purr. it's really cute! is that his way of saying "i love you too"?﻿

comments.text: its called blinking﻿
